name: The Game Of Sequence Quiz | Board Games | 10 Questions

questions.text: Sequence can be played with one person.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Sequence can only be played by a group of people that is divisible by two or three. There can be three people that play by themselves, but any more than three must be played in teams. Only three teams can play.

questions.text: What color chips are in the game?
questions.explanation:
Red, Green, Blue.

	There are fifty green and blue marker chips and thirty-five red marker chips. Red chips are only to be used if there is a third person playing.

questions.text: How many sequence cards are there?
questions.explanation:
104.

	There are two decks of cards mixed together to make up the sequence cards and the Joker cards are not used in the game.

questions.text: How many sequences in a game with two people does a player need so they can win?
questions.explanation:
two & 2.

	If there are two players or two teams playing Sequence, two sequences must be made before the other player or the other team. If there are three players or three teams playing, then one of the teams must make one sequence only in order to win the game.

questions.text: How many chips are needed to make a sequence?
questions.explanation:
Five.

	Five connected marker chips of the same color are needed to make a sequence.

questions.text: Does the board have wild card markers on it?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	There are four wild card markers in each corner of the board.

questions.text: Which card enables a player to pull an opponents marker from the board?
questions.explanation:
One-eyed Jack.

	The one-eyed Jack allows a player to pull an opponent's marker from the board while the two-eyed Jack gives the player the advantage of putting the players marker chip on any empty space.

questions.correct: A card with no space on the board
options: Losing a card after losing a turn
questions.explanation:
A card with no space on the board.

	When a player has a card in their hand that is taken on the board, the player can discard the dead card and pick up another card from the pile.

questions.text: What happens if a player coaches another play during the game?
questions.correct: Every member on that team forfeits one card
options: Nothing happens because talking is permitted
questions.explanation:
Every member on that team forfeits one card.

	There can be no talking around the table when playing the game. If the deck runs out, the discard piles must be shuffled and used as the draw pile. The winner or winners of the game are the players that complete the correct number of sequences.

JAX, LTD.

	JAX, LTD based in Minneapolis, Minnesota put the Sequence game out in 1982 and again in 1999.
